meanings.definition: Lack of physical or emotional sensitivity.
meanings.sent1: Her insensibilities towards other people's feelings often hurt them.
meanings.sent2: The doctor was concerned about the patient's insensibilities to pain.
meanings.sent3: His insensibilities to the cold weather made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The insensibilities of the stone to the sculptor's chisel were frustrating.
meanings.sent5: The insensibilities of the robot made it difficult to interact with humans.

meanings.sent1: The insensibilities of the numb hand worried the pianist.
meanings.sent2: His insensibilities to danger put him in risky situations.
meanings.sent3: The insensibilities of the sleeping cat amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The insensibilities of the security system allowed the thief to enter unnoticed.
meanings.sent5: The insensibilities of the ghostly figure sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: State of being unaware or indifferent.
meanings.sent1: Their insensibilities to the noise around them made them miss the announcement.
meanings.sent2: The politician's insensibilities to the needs of the people cost him the election.
meanings.sent3: The insensibilities of the sloth towards the passing cars was comical.
meanings.sent4: The insensibilities of the iceberg to the approaching ship led to a disaster.
meanings.sent5: The insensibilities of the student to the teacher's instructions resulted in a failed exam.
